Class Rat

java.lang.Object
GameObject
Rat
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DeathRat, LivingRat
public abstract class Rat extends GameObject
An abstract class to model a rat. Scurries around and dies when appropriate.
Author:
James McWilliams
See Also:

      public void onTick()
      A list of things the rat needs to do every tick.

    • walk

      public void walk()
      Causes the rat to walk in a direction. If multiple directions are valid, it will choose a random one. The rat will only go backwards if no other directions are valid.

    • turnRight

      public Rat.Direction turnRight()
      Returns a direction that the rat would be facing if it turned right.
      Returns:
      a direction that the rat would be facing if it turned right.

    • turnBack

      public Rat.Direction turnBack()
      Returns a direction that the rat would be facing if it turned around.
      Returns:
      a direction that the rat would be facing if it turned around.

    • pickNewDirection

      public Rat.Direction pickNewDirection()
      Chooses a direction for the rat to move in, such that it will not land on a grass tile. It will prioritize moving forward, left or right, only moving backwards when the other three options are not valid (i.e a dead end). IMPORTANT: This will return null if the rat is trapped by 4 grass squares. This shouldn't happen outside of levels created via level editing.
      Returns:
      a valid direction for the rat to move in.

    • getForwardTile

      public Tile getForwardTile()
      Gets the tile to the rat's front, given its current direction.
      Returns:
      The tile directly ahead of the rat.

    • getLeftTile

      public Tile getLeftTile()
      Gets the tile to the rat's left, given its current direction.
      Returns:
      The tile to the rat's left

    • getRightTile

      public Tile getRightTile()
      Gets the tile to the rat's right, given its current direction.
      Returns:
      The tile to the rat's right

    • getRearTile

      public Tile getRearTile()
      Gets the tile behind the rat, given its current direction.
      Returns:
      The tile behind the rat

    • incGasTimer

      public void incGasTimer()
